result.execSummary:
The defendant Valerie U Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid in 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valerie U Moore

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:38 AM Defendant Valerie U Moore in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for jury status hearing, but parties have reached a resolution.
State is in compliance with victim's rights. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
State places offer on the record.
State notes restitution has been paid by co-defendant.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Amended Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  3 days (Credit - 3 days). TIME SERVED;

RESTITUTION: $0;
COSTS: $243; 
DRGOD SURCHARGE: $10; 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Payment of Costs/Surcharges/Fine:  To be paid in 90 days or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.
State's Witness List.
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 6/21/22.

Jury status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defense is requesting a jury trial on the same day as the co-defendant.
Court will issue a trial scheduling order. 

  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case called for status.
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:37 AM Defendant Valerie U Moore in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Alyssa Jay, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery and is set to receive an offer from the State.
Defense requests one further proceeding to discuss.
Defendant may appear by zoom for the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:29 AM Defendant Valerie U Moore in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by Attorney Peter Wolff
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Alta store listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

01:40 PM Defendant Valerie U Moore in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
